transportAdvice: Heraklion's city center and main archaeological sites are walkable, though the hilly terrain and summer heat can make longer walks tiring. Public buses connect the city to major towns and beach resorts across Crete, and taxis are widely available and reasonably easy to hail or find at designated stands.

weather.description: Cool and often rainy with occasional strong winds, making it the quietest time for tourism.
Similar to January with mild temperatures and frequent rain showers, though almond trees begin to bloom.
Early spring brings warmer days and fewer showers, with wildflowers starting to appear across the countryside.
Pleasant and increasingly sunny with comfortable temperatures, ideal for sightseeing without summer crowds.
Warm and mostly dry with long sunny days, marking the start of the tourist season.
Hot and reliably sunny with very little rain, perfect for beach visits and outdoor exploration.
Peak summer heat with intense sunshine and virtually no rain; the Meltemi wind can provide some relief.
The hottest and busiest month, with scorching temperatures and crowded beaches and attractions.
Still warm and sunny with the sea at its warmest, and noticeably fewer crowds than August.
Mild and pleasant with occasional showers returning, a good month for cultural sightseeing.
Noticeably cooler and wetter as autumn deepens, with most beach resorts closing for the season.
Cool and rainy with short days, though the city remains lively with local life and festive atmosphere.
